caption.p: Antiproliferative and cytotoxic effect of crude polysaccharides isolated from S. crispa on human colon epithelial cell line CCD841 CoN and human colon adenocarcinoma cell lines: Caco-2, LS180, and HT-29. The cells were exposed to the culture medium alone (control) or the crude polysaccharides from S. crispa (CPS) at concentrations of 10, 25, 50, and 100 µg/mL for 24 h (LDH assay), for 48 h (BrdU assay) and for 96 h (MTT assay). CSP cytotoxicity was measured photometrically by means of the LDH assay ( A), while the antiproliferative impact of CSP was examined photometrically by means of the MTT assay ( B) and BrdU assay ( C). Results are presented as mean ± SEM of at least 4 measurements. * p < 0.05 versus control, ** p < 0.01 versus control, *** p < 0.001 versus control, one-way ANOVA test; post-test: Tukey.
